tweet: As part of the continuing improvements to Cardano, on the 20th of February, we'll be updating Ouroboros on the Byron mainnet to Ouroboros BFT.  ADA holders don't need to do anything as part of this process. Find out more about this update here:   https://t.co/PHxC1hdxYL

#Cardano has been designed for mainstream adoption in mind from scratch. Three main pillars have been defined at the beginning: scalability, interoperability, and sustainability. Cardano will be ready for mass adoption from a technology point of view.   https://t.co/305fdrBdUT

One thing that's pretty cool about the upcoming OBFT protocol upgrade for Cardano is that we can give people an exact time this will happen.  That may seem obvious to some of you but PoW chains usually have a variable block time making it hard to coordinate updates

#Cardano isn't "DPoS" the way it's described in your article here. Cardano uses a #DynamicProofofStake consensus algorithm called #Ouroboros. The original @binance research also doesn't mention #Cardano nor #Tezos, but explicitly/only #EOS (and some #TRON). Better #FactCheck 👍

Watch more info about #Cardano OBFT from #IOHK that will happen on the current main-net (Byron). The test-net will not be affected.  As a user, you do not need to care about anything. All happens behind the scene.
